entry.title: Viral genomics at omrf
entry.content:
Over the last few days Dr. Miller and I drove the 30 minute to the Oklahoma Medical Research Foundation to complete libary preps on the cDNA viral genomics Dr. Miller obtained during his field work in Bolivia.

This was an a great experience learning genomic library prep of viral genomes and learn a lot about how various Illumina machines work.

Thank you Dr. Wiley for all of your help.

Viral genomics at omrf was originally published by Kevin Hawkins at Kevin Hawkins on January 18, 2017.

entry.title: Genomics lab operational
entry.content:
Happy New Years and the Miller Lab / The Sam Noble Museum Genomics Core Lab is coomplete! I have begun the task of ddRAD-seq library prep on the samples I have collected and requested from various museums.

This begins the genomics work of my dissertation! Needless to say its like Christmas in the Miller Lab.

DNA extraction has begun. Stay tuned, libraries should be complete in a month.

Have a good one everyone, and try to stay warm.

Genomics lab operational was originally published by Kevin Hawkins at Kevin Hawkins on January 13, 2017.

entry.title: Greetings
entry.content:
Welcome to my website! I am a Ecology and Evolutionary Biology doctoral student in the Department of Ornithology at the Sam Noble Oklahoma Museum of Natural History and the The Department of Biology at the The University of Oklahoma.

Greetings was originally published by Kevin Hawkins at Kevin Hawkins on December 26, 2016.
